[h1]Pros:[/h1]
- 150 abwechslungsreiche Level

[h1]Cons:[/h1]

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Divide By Sheep ist ein umfangreiches Puzzlespiel, welches ursprünglich aus dem Mobile-Segment stammt. Das kann man nur bei der Bedienung und dem kompletten UI erkennen, da sonst keinerlei Probleme auftreten. Das Spiel bietet 10 herausfordernde und teils bockschwere Level, die allesamt abwechslungsreich gestaltet und optisch ansprechend sind. Aber es sei gesagt, dass das Spiel zur Frustration führen kann. In Divide By Sheep werden die Gameplayelemente durch Bildreihen eingefügt, wodurch das Spiel einen gewissen Charme verliehen bekommt. Insgesamt ein mathematisches und recht preisgünstiges Puzzlespiel!

38043730.review:
150 tightly designed levels keep you consistently interested throughout. 

Divide By Sheep is a lazy mobile port. Not a bad mobile port. In fact, its even a good port in some respects. But two glaring errors stuck out to me, the PC user. First one is nitpicking and doesn't affect anything but leaving a "please rate the app" screen at the end of the menus is just bad form. Then there was no resolution/windowed control. And this being a time-filler puzzle game it is primed for being played while consuming other media. Windowed mode (without 3rd party programs) should be considered a must. So alt+tab'ing ensued and I will note I suffered some framerate hiccups upon doing that. The game does look good at 1080p and runs at a solid 60 frames otherwise though. 

The port issues aside, this game is great. The wacky theme and art. The tight puzzles. The bright color palette. It all works. The 150 puzzles are all well constructed in their simplicity. Each level features 9 or less platforms with three sets of requirements to clear. It starts with hopping sheep around. But ends up with wolves, pigs, lasers, meat eating octopus, portals, traps, flames, totems, and more. The game regularly provides new wrinkles to the puzzles. Right when one set of mechanics is wearing thin and you are in a groove you run into something new. If you go for all the "stars" on every level you'll find yourself with a solid 7~8+ hours of gameplay. Very much worth the price.

Easy recommendation to the puzzling puzzlers out there.

36633715.review:
Döden börjar känna sig ensam och vill därför ha lite sällskap. Men döden fungerar inte riktigt som andra. Dödens metod att förbättra sällskapslivet är att översvämma ett slättområde bebott av får, vargar och grisar, och sedan förse de överlevande med ett litet antal flottar som bara kan bära ett exakt antal passagerare som är av exakt art.

Nästan alla spel behöver en bakgrundshistoria, men jag är inte säker på om Divide by Sheep egentligen krävde det. Historien är i alla fall en bra ursäkt för att göra klurigheterna lite roligare. I grund och botten är spelet ju ett rent matematiskt pussel av ganska klassisk typ. De olika djuren kan röra sig från en kulle till en intilliggande, och kommer fler djur till kullen än vad som får plats dör de överflödiga individerna, och vargar äter både får och grisar, medan grisarna tränger ut fåren, och laserstrålar delar fåren i två halvor, och mätta vargar kan inte längre hoppa, och dynamiten exploderar när den sista lämnar den, och taggtrådar kan man inte passera, och vargfällorna slukar vargar men inga andra djur, och så vidare.

Svårighetsnivån, och komplexiteten, på de olika pusslen ökar i lagom takt så man kan sitta rätt länge med Divide by Sheep utan att tröttna. Det hjälper också att spelet rent visuellt blandar extrem gullighet med rätt morbida blodigheter (man klyver ju får på mitten ibland), och att musiken driver på.

Så spelet är trevligt, klurigt, och allmänt gulligt. Ett utmärkt sätt att slå ihjäl, eller kanske slakta, någon kvart emellanåt.

35333458.review:
Das Spiel ist gut.

Hier wird uns reine Rätselkost ohne "störende" Geschichte vorgesetzt. Gegeben ist in jedem der wohl 150 Level eine Welt voller benachbarter Insel bestimmter Größe, bevölkert mit Schafen und Wölfen (später auch Schweinen).

Aufgabe ist es, die Tiere in drei vorgegebenen Mengen in dieser Reihenfolge einer Rettung zuzuführen.

Schräger Humor lockert die ansonsten rein abstrakte Aufgabe erfreulich auf.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1152235525

Bei der Bewegung der Tiere von Insel zu Insel fallen nicht nur diese, die keinen Platz mehr finden ins Wasser und ertrinken. Auchh jeder nichtsatte Wolf frisst ein (1) Schaf, kann sich dafür aber nicht mehr bewegen.

Kolletaralschäden werden also billigend in Kauf genommen. Selbst halbierte Schafe werden angenommen und auf dem Rettungsboot wieder (mit einem Gürtel) zu einem Ganzen verbunden.

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad steigt nach dem ersten Abschnitt (je 30 Rätsel) erheblich an.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1152236023

Bei der Lösung kommt es dem Spiel nicht darauf an, wieviele Züge man benötigte, sondern nur das Ergebnis zählt. Eine perfekte Lösung wird mit drei Sternen belohnt, man muss aber nur ein Rettungsboot korrekt füllen, um die ansonsten gesperrten nachfolgenden Level angehen zu können.

Die Zwischensequenzen, die neue Spielelemente erklären sollen, waren mir allerdings eher unverständlich. Meist war es letzlich selbsterklärend, manchmal musste ich aber auch etwas rumprobieren, bis ich die Funktionsweise verstanden habe.

Das Spiel bietet an sich nichts zu bemängeln. Es bedarf aber eine starke Fähigkeit zu recht abstrakten Rechenspielen, um durch geeignetes hin- und herwerfen der Tiere auf genau die gewünschte Anzahl an Tieren zu kommen. Auf die Lösung kommt man ja aber auch nicht so einfach, wie man die Lösung einer Gleichung finden mag, sondern es bieten sich mir einfach zu viele Möglichkeiten, um noch den Durchblick bewahren zu können. Vielleicht komme ich aber mit der Zeit weiter. Ich habe mir das Spiel zum Weiterspielen vorgemerkt. Immerhin werde ich aber alle Level wohl freischalten können. Immerhin.

Die Grafik ist einfach und OK. Süß und auch makaber mit den großen Blutflecken und ähnlichem.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1152238888

Die Handhabung mit der Maus ist fast einfach. Es genügt allerdings leider nicht, die gewünschte Hüpfrichtung der Inselbewohner anzudeuten, sondern man sollte die Maus immer bis zur nächsten Insel bewegen, ehe man loslässt. Es hat eine Weile gedauert, bis ich das gemerkt habe.

Es gibt sehr viele Errungenschaften, die nicht so leicht zu ergattern sind, aber außer Rätsellösen keine anderen Tätigkeiten erfordert, denke ich.

Pro & Contra:

+ Ein schönes Rätselprinzip
+ Amüsant-makabre Animation

o 150 teils sehr gute, teils sehr schwere Rätsel

Wertung: 8/10

Das Spiel ist ein von der Idee und Umsetzung überaus schönes Spiel.

Letztlich gefielen mir viele der Rätsel doch nicht ganz so gut, weil sie mir (arme Mathematikerseele) zuwenig zielstrebige Lösungsverfolgung boten.

Ansonsten hätte es auch 10/10 erhalten. Wer solche Heruasforderung also mag, kann ich es wärmstens empfehlen.

34430577.review:
Divide By Sheep è simpatico puzzle game basato sulla matematica.

Il gioco è suddviso in 5 mondi, ciascuno dei quali con proprie peculiarità sotto forma di "variabile" che si aggiunge ai vari modi in cui un livello va completato. Animali nuovi, piattaforme diverse, ecc.

Il vostro compito è sostanzialmente quello di risolvere gli enigmi (3 per livello) calcolando e spostando gli elementi nell'almbiente. Ogni elemento ha caratteristiche diverse dagli altri ed essi verranno inseriti e spiegati nel gioco durante il normale gameplay. Pecore, Maiali, Lupi, Trampolini, TNT... Tutti elementi che vi troverete ad usare per risolvere i puzzle.

I principali obiettivi riguardano il portare alla zattera tot animali dello stesso tipo (es. pecore) facendo attenzione a non sforare mai, altrimenti l'obiettivo nn sarà completato. La zattera partirà solo quando abbastanza piena e se il numero è corretto l'obiettivo sarà completato.
Vi sono inoltre alcuni obiettivi più particolari come l'uccidere gli animali (per poter trasportare le anime) o trascinare un totem fino alla zattera.

In tutto vi sono 150 livelli (30 ogni mondo, per 5 mondi), ognuno dei quali con 3 obiettivi rappresentati dalle solite stelle.

Il gioco è un palese porting dalla versione mobile, lo si nota bene nel menù principale (e anche nel "rate app" in fondo ai livelli...), tuttavia la fattura è ottima (non ho giocato la versione mobile quindi non posso fare paragoni).
Grafica cartoonesca adatta, ambienti semplici ma ben curati.
La colonna sonora è fantastica (solitamente nei giochi puzzle la disattivo perchè troppo disturbante, questa invece l'ho trovata piacevole).

Ho riscontrato solamente un problemino... Se si resetta il livello mentre si stanno ancora muovendo degli elementi può capitare che il gioco rallenti un attimo con tanto di effetti sonori fastidiosi.

Per il resto il gioco è facilmente completabile al 100% (basta raccogliere tutte le stelle).

Consiglio assolutamente! Uno dei più bei giochi puzzle mai giocati!

34067146.review:
A poor mobile port that is still worth playing.

There are 5 worlds, each containing 30 levels. Every 15 levels or so a new gameplay mechanic is introduced, which works well to keep the game interesting as the mechanics are then combined to increase complexity. 

Each level is comprised of 3 tasks that need to be accomplished sequentially. The way with which you complete a task affects whether or not it is possible to complete the next one and so on. As such, you often need to plan ahead to make sure you have enough sheep/wolves/pigs to save/kill. While it's not necessary to get 3 stars to advance, I feel without the challenge I'd be bored, particularly because finishing just the first 2 tasks is always easy.

The humorous premise and cute creepy visuals, the overall number of levels and gameplay mechanics, along with the (always acceptable) challenge combine for a worthy experience.

The size of the buttons, the menu navigation, lack of options, no working alt+tab, and no cloud saves make it clear little effort was put into bringing the game to Steam. The controls are also better suited for a touch screen. As such, you may be better off getting it on mobile, but it is good enough that I can recommend it on PC as well.

La dificultad esta en saber moverlas en el orden correcto para perder ovejas si es necesario y asi completar el numero requerido. Esto es la base, pero se van sumando elementos que van añadiendo nuevas mecanicas que cambian por completo la forma de pensar los niveles.

33582430.review:
Got this through Humble Bundle.

Right now I'm probably 90% done.

Pros:
* Really fun, cute game. Played this at the airport, and time just flew by. The animals do twists and turns when jumping, and I feel just like when the wolves when they're satisfied.
* Challenging too. What's great is that there are multiple ways to solve the puzzles, but probably only one way to get the full 3 Stars for every level.
* Lenient. You can skip to the next level even if you cannot get to 3 Stars. Get 1 Star and you're free, and the vast majority of 1 Stars is easy.
* Appropriate number of "tools". You have sheep, wolf, pigs, burning statue, TNT, wolf traps and fire traps. Each level will use a certain number of these, but they never seem overwhelming.
* Appropriate number of goals. You can save sheep, wolves, pigs and/or statue, kill them, or feed them to a giant squid. Each level will indicate which goal to achieve. Keeps things fresh (like the sheep, mmm).
* Funny too when blood is introduced (never expected that), but you can easily disable it.
* Steam cards are adorable!

Cons:
* Music can slowly get annoying if listened to for an hour or more.
* Steam Achievements don't work.
* Little replay value. Once you finished a puzzle with 3 Stars, you're done.

32990099.review:
[h1]The Bad[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Advertising it as a "math puzzler" is deeply misleading. It is a logistic puzzle about animals on platforms. You can express the problems in mathematical terms, but this is rarely helpful and would never advance beyond basic addition or subtraction.
    [*]It's a mobile port and as such poorly optimized for mouse interactions and offers no windowed mode. Click-Drag-and-Release is a strenuous main mechanic for a puzzle game.
    [*]It's thematically confused. It mixes saving cute fluffy sheep with gruesomely slicing them in halves and feeding them to wolves. I'm fine with cute and I'm fine with morbid/gore, but the two don't really mix.
    [*]The game uses no words and tells its "story" in cryptic images which also serve as very poor explanations for new mechanics. Trial and error is inevitable, as you can't rely on the tutorial images.
    [*]The difficulty sometimes varies a lot level to level. It's not annoying and I recognize that different people might find different levels hard though.
    [*]No endless mode or user-generated levels, which is sad, but not a huge draw-back. The mechanics don't really lend themselves to ever increasing complexity and I'm glad the game doesn't overstay its welcome.
    [*]I experienced 1 major bug/crash where upon level transition it didn't load the story interlude and basically hard-locked/froze the game. Not a big deal.
[/list]
[h1]The Good[/h1]
[list]
    [*]The graphics, animations and design are simple yet gorgeous. You can tell the game is polished well.
    [*]The puzzles are solid, entertaining and get you thinking 10 steps ahead.
    [*]There is a wide variety of diverse mechanics and goals which are gradually introduced, so it never becomes boring or repetitive.
    [*]There is way more content than I expected for the price tag. Bought at 80% off during a sale this is an amazing value proposition! It took me about 9 hours to casually exhaust the game and I can actually see myself replaying it in a few years.
    [*]To progress you only have to finish 1 of 3 goals per level, so you can almost always skip levels that stump you and come back later.
[/list]
A definite recommendation on sale and if you like this type of puzzle it's probably worth full price even.

32961137.review:
[h1]Schäfchen zählen... [/h1]

"Divide By Sheep" ist ursprünglich ein Androidspiel, welches auf den PC und auf Steam geportet wurde. Im Google Play Store kostet es nur 1,10 €.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
In "Divide By Sheep" müssen wir in der Vogelperspektive die exakt richtige Anzahl an Schafen auf das Boot kriegen, welches an einer Stelle im Level erscheint. Dabei haben wir in jedem Level immer 3 "Aufträge". Das heißt z. B. man muss 3,5,2 Schafe in exakt dieser Reihenfolge aufs Schiff bringen. Jedoch besitzt jede Insel, auf denen die Schafe umherhüpfen können, nur eine bestimmte Anzahl an Plätzen. Überzählige Schafe fallen runter, sobald der Platz voll ist und auch damit muss man dann kalkulieren. Für jeden "Auftrag" gibt es einen Stern, wobei man eine gewisse Anzahl Sterne zum Weitermachen benötigt. Dabei kann man auch einen Auftrag versemmeln, z.B. durch zuviele Schafe. In diesem Fall kann man dann aber einfach den nächsten Stern noch bekommen. 
Bleibt das Spiel so simpel? Haha, nein! Das Spiel bringt laufend neue Mechaniken dazu: Wölfe, die man auch aufs Floß bringen muss und die Schafe fressen, Laserstrahlen, welche die Schafe in zwei Hälften teilen, Trennwände und vieles mehr. Die Spielmechaniken sind sehr ausgeklügelt und fordern den Spieler jeden Alters. Dennoch reicht es, wenn man in dem Level nur einen Stern hat, damit man halt weiterkommt. Nur insgesamt muss die Anzahl eben stimmen.

[b]Story[/b]
Story ist nicht wirklich vorhanden. Der Sensenmann ist ein wenig unser Charakter, den wir verfolgen. Dieser kommt dann ab der dritten Welt ins Spiel und man muss genau die richtige Zahl an Tieren umbringen. Ansonsten versuchen die Schafe und Wölfe natürlich zu fliehen.

[b]Grafik/Sound[/b]
Das Spiel hat einen lieblichen Comic-look, der eine heitere und lustige Atmossphäre verspricht. Die Tiere und Animationen sind witzig gestaltet, so weinen die Schafe z. B. sobald man sie anklickt. Im Grunde hätte ich gesagt, dass das Spiel kindgerecht wirkt, nur die zerfetzenden Laserstrahlen sind doch dann arg brutal für Kinderaugen. Aber lustig sind sie trotzdem.
Die Melodie schließt sich der Grafik an und verspricht Heiterkeit. Die Schafe blöken vor sich hin und die wenigen anderen Sounds sind auch gut getroffen. Die Musik ist nichts Besonderes, lässt den Spieler sich aber entspannen.


[b]Fazit[/b]
"Divide By Sheep" ist ein lustiges kleines Puzzlespiel, bei dem man gut rechnen muss. Die Grafik und Musik sind lustig gestaltet und es kommen mit passenden Abständen immer wieder Veränderungen im Gameplay. Wer sich nicht die teurere Version auf Steam kaufen möchte, kann ja im Google Play Store vorbeischauen. Einen Kauf ist das Spiel auf jeden Fall wert!


Wenn dir das Review gefallen hat, würde ich mich freuen, wenn du meiner Kuratorgruppe auf Steam folgst, um auch meine Reviews zu anderen Spielen zu bekommen: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool
Mittlerweile veröffentliche ich meine Reviews auch in der Deutsch/Germany Gruppe auf Steam: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Deutschland-Germany#

Divide by sheep. It's cute, sleek, simple in concept, but surprisingly mathy when it gets down to it. 

Yes the game feels like it's designed for mobile, but it's just as nice on PC, no real draw backs to using a mouse instead of touch control. 

For 5$ you definitely get your money's worth. For me this wasn't the kind of game I could just plow through all the puzzles in one sitting. Just when you're getting used to the logic and process of figuring out one type of puzzle, the game throws in a new mechanic that requires you to change your approach entirely. 

If you love brain teaser games this would be fun for you. Don't go in expecting a relaxing casual mind number, it can be  frustraiting after spending too long on one puzzle.

It's gonna be a long time before I finish all the levels, but in small play increments this be a nice game to have around.

32203968.review:
Divide by Sheep est un petit jeu de réflexion dans lequel vous allez manipuler des cochons, des moutons et des loups. Le but du jeu est assez simple : ramener dans un bateau les bons animaux avec le bon nombre d’entre eux. 

     Mais voilà, les choses ne sont pas si simples, les loups mangent les moutons et les cochons, les cochons expulsent les moutons, les lasers découpent les moutons en deux… Bref tout un tas d’obstacles vont vous compliquer la vie pour réaliser vos objectifs, et parfois la solution semble simple, parfois on se prend la tête.

     Pourtant ce jeu est vraiment l’ami du joueur. D’une part vous n’êtes pas obligé de réaliser tous les objectifs d’un tableau -c’est pourtant là que réside le vrai challenge proposé par le jeu- et vous pouvez ainsi explorer les niveaux sans vous retrouver bloqué. Car, il faut l’admettre, c’est parfois un petit point de détail qui nous bloque dans l’obtention des trois étoiles -récompense obtenue en complétant les trois objectifs. En plus le jeu est joli, coloré et apporte une certaine dose d’humour sous forme de petites BD sans texte entre certaines missions. 

     Un jeu vraiment sympa.
7/10

31881641.review:
Divide by Sheep is a pretty simple and straightforward puzzle game. The premise is that Death is lonely, and decides to collect himself some animal friends. Thus, the game centers around killing cute, fuzzy creatures.

Really, the game is at its core about manipulating objects – sheep, wolves, and pigs – around a 2D environment. There are a series of platforms laid out in a grid, and each platform has anywhere between 1 and 9 spaces on it for animals to stand on. If you boot an animal over onto another platform, and there isn’t room for it, it will be ejected from it. If you put wolves onto a platform with sheep or pigs, or vice-versa, the wolves will eat the sheep/pigs and become fat and immobile, locking off spaces from landing on them. If you bounce pigs onto a platform with sheep, the pigs will land on the sheep and kill them. If anything is on a platform with a pig, only the pig will be ejected when you launch from it.

These simple rules, combined with a few other things – a fence preventing ejection between platforms; a laser cutter which chops sheep in half (but not other things), doubling the space they take up; TNT spots, which blow up if nothing is left on the platform, removing it from play; frying spots, which burn up one animal on them per move; burners, which are turned off by buttons on another platform; a portal platform, which teleports back excess animals instead of killing them; a bounce pad, which immediately ejects any animal which lands on it onto one or more adjacent platforms (some will eject onto two, splitting the animals evenly between them); and a totem, which kills anything else on the platform it is on but can be bounced around from platform to platform by the player and is otherwise invincible – make up the gameplay.

The goal is to ship out three sets of animals, in order. Boats come on the top-left of the screen, and your goal is to load exactly the right number of exactly the right kind of animal onto the boats. There are boats for each of the wolves, sheep, and pigs, as well as a boat for Death himself, which requires you to kill X many animals (making their souls appear on his boat), and a sea monster, which just requires X amount of any sort of animal (it isn’t a picky eater). There’s also a boat for a totem on a few of the levels.

The boats won’t leave until they’re filled (or overfilled), and while you only have to get one right to progress, you need to get almost all of the boats filled to unlock consecutive worlds.

Thus, the goal is to get exactly the right number of animals onto the boats using the various platforms and mechanics given to you. The game gradually introduces new mechanics over its length, adding about one new mechanic every 10-15 levels, helping it to keep itself relatively fresh as it adds ever more complexity to its puzzles.

Overall, the game has 150 levels, spanning 5 worlds, and takes somewhere on the order of 6-8 hours to 100%. It isn’t terribly hard, generally speaking, but a few of them levels require quite a bit of cleverness to solve; none of the levels takes more than a minute or so to solve correctly, but you may be stuck on them for ten times that long if you can’t figure out the right trick. It is ultimately very much math-based, and oftentimes the process of elimination is necessary to try and figure out all the ways that clearly won’t work, so you can figure out the one way that will.

This is a fairly decent puzzle game, and the mechanics work well for what it is. However, it is very simple, and unless you really enjoy simple puzzle games without much in the way of story or anything else, there’s nothing else here for you. 

That being said, this is really a game you will probably enjoy more on your phone than on your PC; it isn’t a sit down and play it for hours game (though you can do so), it is more of a throwaway thing.

Overall, this is very squarely directed at a puzzle game player – the sort of simple puzzle game you might play on your phone or a similar mobile device. If you like pure puzzle games, this is a decent game, but it is hard for me to muster much enthusiasm for it - while it certainly was clever at times, and its mechanics were simple and clean, I just was never wowed by it. It is just sort of a par for the course game - never quite dull, but never all that interesting, either. If you don’t like pure puzzle games, or if you like plot or purpose or anything else, this game will likely bore you.

31756124.review:
Das Spiel ist für Knobelfreunde sicher sehr kurzweilig und enthält einige sehr interessante Spielmechaniken, die ich in dieser Art in Knobelspielen noch nicht gesehen habe.
Die niedlich-bunte Grafik und der passende Sound bilden einen schönen Kontrast zum teils sehr fiesen Spielgeschehen, das aber dennoch nie wirklich eklig wird. Für Kinder ist es dennoch nicht geeignet.
Die Rätsel sind manchmal herausfordernd aber auch wegen der nicht übermäßig hohen Anzahl möglicher Züge immer in vertretbarer Zeit lösbar. Frustration ist bei mir noch nie aufgekommen, wohl aber ungläubiges Kopfschütteln verbunden mit einem Grinsen, welch absurd anmutender Lösungsansatz tatsächlich zum Ziel führte. Kann man ja auch nicht ahnen, dass drei halbe Schafe aus der einen Gruppe plus fünf halbe Schafe aus der anderen im Rettungsboot zu den geforderten vier ganzen Schafen zusammengetackert werden. Klebeband hilft anscheinend bei allem...
Anfangs war ich irritiert von den eher schmal ausfallenden Erklärungen in Form von recht putzigen Comics, habe aber schnell festgestellt, dass diese einem eine Grundidee der neuen Mechanik vermitteln und man die Details derselben schnell durch Ausprobieren begreift.
Insgesamt ist das Spiel sehr empfehlenswert und ich freue mich, dass ich es gekauft habe.
Ich fürchte nur, dass ich (trotz sehr ordentlicher Levelzahl) viel schneller am Spielende sein werde als mir lieb ist.

30262754.review:
Divide by Sheep is a fun math puzzle game with solid amount of levels. It might look a like cheap mobile port, but underneath there's a very solid and clever puzzle game.

The game starts simple enough. You just need to move groups of sheep between platforms and get the exact right amount of them on the rafts. But the game keeps adding more and more elements to this simple formula and soon enough you are also dealing with wolves, pigs, dynamite platforms, laser fences and many other complications. 

The constant introduction of new gameplay elements keeps the game fresh and interesting. There's a good amount of content too, especially if you decide to get full three stars in each level.

Despite the cute art style the game has some seriously dark undertones. Many of the levels actually require you to sacrifice a certain amount of cute animals and using the game's internal logic it makes perfect sense that a sheep cut in half by a laser fence still counts as one if you patch it back together.

The controls are clearly optimized for touch, but the mouse controls work reasonably well too. The game also has a rather prominent "Rate this App" link, which really should have been removed from the Steam release. On a positive note there are no microtransactions or gamebreaking powerups.

Overall Divide by Sheep is a highly enjoyable math puzzle game with lots of clever ideas and interesting levels. I'd recommend it to any puzzle game fans.

The good:
- Great puzzles
- Does a good job of introducing new gameplay elements
- Lots of levels
- Cute art with a dark twist

The bad:
- The tutorials can be somewhat confusing
- Controls are optimized for touch
- Prominent "Rate this App" link

28759803.review:
One of the best puzzle games I played this year.

In my opinion it's not a pure math puzzler like other games like Hexcell or Knight. Divide by Sheep has plenty of mechanisms that are more relevant to logic (wolves eating sheeps then blocking cells, pigs taking priority over sheeps, lasers cutting sheeps in half but not wolves, switching platforms, triggered burners, portals, and so on..). Each element appears around every 10 levels, which makes the game never boring and always fun all along the 150 levels.

The longevity is very good, it took me 18h to complete the 150 levels at 100%, which make an average of 7mn per level, please note that I'm very slow, and that around 20% of the levels can be solved in less than 2mn, while some other ones can easily take more than 10mn. One very good point is that the difficulty is not increasing continuously like in most puzzlers, instead, some levels are sometimes more easy than the previous ones, and I never been stuck or felt frustrated. Knowing that the next level can be easier is very motivating. When finishing the game you will be granted with a 100% achievement.

Apart from that, the graphic design is a total success with its colorfull look, animations are smooth and very fun, maybe one bad point is that the screen resolution is locked, but it's really not a problem. The game is also divided in 5 worlds, each one with his own graphic design, mechanisms and music soundtrack (variations on the main theme). The game was made with Adobe Air (which is a very solid engine for such games), and it was designed first for touchscreen (I imagine that a tablet version should exist, I didn't check), but works perfectly with the mouse as well. There is also a parental lock if you want to remove the gore and let your 5yo kid play (it's a fun game for kids too).

If you're into puzzle games, don't hesitate one second.
9/10

28142983.review:
Divide by Sheep is math puzzle game disguised with cute critters. Yes, you also divide.
Let me get it out of the way: this is a blatant mobile port that nonetheless ends up working ok with a mouse.

The basic mechanics have you throw groups of critters from one island to the next, with the goal of satisfying 3 requests in each, be it save an exact amount of them or kill a certain number. These requests are tied to the layout of the map and require you to move around the animals until you've satisfied them all in sequence.
You can merge groups on a single island (2 sheeps + 3 sheeps = 5 sheep!) as well as "decrease them" by throwing more than an island can take and drowning the excess. I should also mention that you [i]literally[/i] divide sheep with laser grids. In half. A bloody half. And two halves make a whole, don't forget!
Things get more complex as the game gives you more critters who interact differently with one another (wolves eat all others, pigs squash sheeps, the golden idol that exists somehow squashes everything...) as well as different types of islands that disappear when left empty or burn any visitor.

While the game is fun, it doesn't have a very good progression; the difficulty varies wildly from one stage and the next, but it somehow manages to be fun for the most part. 
I have to point out that it does overstay its welcome by a couple dozen stages; the last world adds slightly uninspired elements that were most likely added just to increase the duration of the game. The achievement structure also suggests this: the "get everything" unlocks after the second-to-last world, with one more "get everything" unlocking after you're done with the last world as well.

All in all, Divide by Sheep is a cute puzzle game, but I wouldn't suggest it to those who don't already love the genre.
To such players, go ahead and get it during a discount for a few hours of fun; feel also free to let go when you get bored though: sadly, there's no majestic puzzle design waiting for you in its last phases.

26931352.review:
(This Review was orginally published on Gamegrin.com at http://www.gamegrin.com/reviews/divide-by-sheep-review/)

The story behind Divide by Sheep is total whimsy. Death is a lonely little soul with a sheep fetish (maybe he’s from Buxton, I don’t know), he just loves those wooly little ruminants. Being an anthropomorphic personification of the slide into decrepitude and the inevitable surcease of life, he can only be friendly with dead things. As a result and in a leap of somewhat startlingly stark logic, he decides to kill everything. In a flood. Old Testament style. Sploosh.

Now this is where you come in, it’s your task to float the little darlings on to rafts and rescue them from his bony clutches. So far so simple, but wait, they are on islands, and some islands only hold so many sheep. If you get them to jump from an island that can hold, say seven sheep onto one holding only four, three of them will drown and spent eternity as the grim reapers fluffy playthings! Ah well, them’s the breaks. Of course, just like islands, some rafts can only hold so many sheep, so you will have to strategically drown some of them anyway just to get to the end of the level.

And so it goes, sheep drown, sheep live, and as the game progresses you get to slice them in half with lasers (they get duct taped back together on the raft, don’t worry), bounce them off trampolines, and feed them to wolves. Of course, wolves need rescuing too, so them too get to bounce about like little black motes of soot. A fed wolf can’t bounce as that would cause nasty vomitory complications so they just sit there looking happy while the raft floats off into the sunset. While you tax your brain trying to work out how to meet all three victory conditions for the level or at least one of them so you can move on and see what devilry has been set in store for you next.

Visually, this game screams out what it is, a mobile game that has come to Steam. With blocky, voxel style graphics, cutesy sounds and music, and a user interface that screams out “I was on an iPhone” in a loud squeaky voice.

None of this detracts from the inherent addictiveness of flinging sheep at laser beams, fences and the occasional kraken however, in fact it enhances the dark comedic nature of the game and has you giggling at the animated cut-scenes that explain the latest twist to the game play with visuals of bisected ruminants, flying ungulates, and snapping canidae.

On the whole, Divide by Sheep is a cute, enjoyable, darkly comedic time sucker of a game. It has a real “one more level” appeal to it that has had me sit to play it, and then wonder why my freshly made coffee is now cold on more than one occasion. tinyBUILD have made a bit of a corker here, and it’s well worth the 4 quid it costs on Steam

Divide by Sheep is a nice logical game with elements of brutality towards animals. 
Death was lonely. Who wouldn't be (I know thousands of people die every day. But really - people are boring)? So he decides to have some animals dead to have some friends. 
Players goal is to deliver exact amount of animals (Sheeps, Wolves or Pigs) to the raft. To do it, player has to move groups of animals between islands, increasing or decreasing (mostly by drowning) groups to make them fit into the raft. There are many types of islands, eg. ones that swap places of groups without them killing each other, there are lasers that work only on sheeps - they cut them in half, so you need two squares per helf of the sheep, and you need to deliver any 2 parts of the sheep to the raft. There are few more blocks, but these are just examples. 
Each animal have different relationship towards the others - Wolves eat sheep, pigs always kick their groups amount of animals from the island they land on and so on. 
Later in game there are more raft types; not only you have to deliver few animal types, but you have also ones that require you to kill specified amount of any animal, or deliver exact amount of any animals to the giant squid. 
Overally, this is a good game. Sure it gets hard sometines, but that's the charm of all logical games. With 150 levels aviable, it's a lot you get for 5 euro.

24727930.review:
Divide by Sheep is one of the most fun math puzzle games I have played ever since I joined Steam nearly three years ago.

The main objective of putting varying amounts of sheep onto the live-saving rafts (and later on even wolves and pigs, all with their own quirks when moving them from island to island) is not as simple as it seems at first. Sure, the start into the game is very commonly done. Easy puzzle first, some jumping about, almost no way of mucking it up.

Then come the fences.
And the laser barriers.
The wolves eating the sheep.
Pigs making everything slippery.
Islands of varying size not permitting for more than a certain amount of animals to pass.
Islands getting blown up when they are left.
Tiles that set sheep on fire.
And even a big, big, stomping idol that squishes anything in its way.

It's hilarious, and it's a fun brain-tease. Let's just hope that Death doesn't make the mistake again to flood the Earth in order to have more friends.

23597824.review:
[h1][u]Game Information[/u][/h1]

Divide by Sheep, is a IPA* game, developed by Victor Solodilov and Denis Novikov; published by tinyBuild.

There is a storyline for the game but it isn't much to it nor its' rememberable.

IPA - Indie Puzzle Adventure

[h1][u]Game Visuals[/u][/h1]

I want to mentioned that the visuals for this game is nicely done. The visuals can be adjusted in the option menu.

[h1][u]Game Audio[/u][/h1]

I want to mentioned that the audio for this game is well done even if it's simplistic and somewhat repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the option menu as well.

[h1][u]Gameplay[/u][/h1]

There are no difficult modes to choose from but each of the levels has their own difficulty.

There are five worlds with thirty levels in total six hundred levels. All levels has three stars to earn.

There's an option for resetting the level if an error has been made. All levels can be replayed to earn all three stars. The first world is automatically unlock but the other four worlds are locked. They required a certain amount of stars to unlock them.

New game mechanics are introduced into the game as it progresses. As it being said the puzzles will certainly get tricky to solve.

There nineteen achievements to earned but each has a requirement before they can be unlocked. 

[h1][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/h1]

There are total of six different trading cards. You only get the three of those cards from the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading card: Purchased from Steam's Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and it's Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts, I've found this game enjoyable to certain extend. The replay value for this game is low. I would recommend this game but not at the full price.

23189789.review:
Who said sheeps are always innocent? Divide by Sheep proves that not every sheep is as innocent as the German proverb 'I am innocent like a sheep' says.

The goal of this puzzle game is sending the exact amount of sheeps to the life boat which is given at the start of each level. This is done by using the platforms the wooly animals are standing on and "shooting" them to neighbouring ones. However if the number of sheeps exceeds the space on the platforms, you can watch some sheeps taking a dive into the water. But ofcourse sheeps aren't the only characters you need to complete each level: as soon as you think that you get the gist of this "easy" game, you will meet pigs, wolfs and painful-sheep cutting lasers as well as other mechanis to not only fill life boats but also the ride of the grim reaper.

This game is a good way to get your logical thinking going, if you try to get a perfect completion on every single level. For people who aren't aversed to puzzle games that are repetitive in its main goal and are looking for a time killing challenge, Divide by Sheep is definitely a good game to get their brain cells going without having to rage quit too much. (Better get it on a sale, if you have a chance. Else it might hit the limit you might be willing to offer for a puzzle game you can only complete once without losing the fun)
People who are more disdained to repetitive game play or are expecting a big complex story should probably avoid it.

양과 늑대, 돼지를 세는 재미있는 수학시간~

양과 늑대를 각 발판 사이로 이리저리 이동시키며 정해진 숫자만큼 제시된 보트에 태우는 게임이다. 정해진 크기 이상의 양들이 착지하려 할 경우 모자란 발판만큼은 당연히 양이 떨어져버린다. 그리고 늑대는 양을 잡아먹고, 양을 잡아먹은 늑대는 퍼져서 더 이상 움직이지 않는다. 이런 간단한 알고리즘을 활용해서 각 스테이지마다 제시하는 것들을 정확히 태우는 것이 이 게임의 목적.

게임을 진행하다보면 스프링이나 폭발, 희생 같은 특성을 지닌 발판들도 등장하고, 나중에는 특성이 양과 비슷하지만 미묘하게 다른 돼지도 등장한다. 그래도 새로운 것들이 나올 땐 쉽게 이해할 수 있도록 쉬운 스테이지를 제공해주기도 하니 새로운 것에 적응가긴 그닥 어렵진 않다. 컷신으로 중간중간 나오는 그림들은 도대체 뭔 의미인지 이해하기 어려웠지만.

조금은 어려운 퍼즐 게임이기도 하다. 이런 퍼즐 게임이 전부 그렇겠지만, 한 번 사고가 막히기 시작하면 대책없을 정도로 헤메기 십상이니... 본인도 서너번 공략 참조해가며 플레이했었다. 심각하게 막힌다면, 혼자서 너무 머리 꽁꽁 싸매지 말고 적당히 공략을 참조하도록 하자.

원래 게임이 모바일에 최적화되어서 그런건지 전반적인 인터페이스도 모바일스럽고, 무엇보다 창모드도 지원이 안 된다. 그리고 가끔 스테이지 리로드 해올 때 뭔가 이상하게 심한 렉이 걸릴 때가 가끔 생긴다. 게임 자체가 괜찮아서 그 정도 불편함은 어느 정도 참고 플레이하긴 했다만, 확실히 스마트폰이나 태블릿으로 플레이하는 편이 더 편했을 듯 하다.

그래픽도 깔끔했고 캐릭터들도 귀여워서 좋았던 퍼즐 게임. 난이도가 꽤 있는 편이니 지긋이 고민하며 풀기에 훌륭한 퍼즐 게임이다.

21200997.review:
Divide by Sheep is (perhaps surprisingly) fun, even if math isn't your strongest suit. It is, at its core, a puzzle/logic game. Don't let the mathiness intimidate you, if you are wont to be intimidated by mathiness. Players are able to engage in unlimited trial and error to sort out each level, as needed. Nevertheless, there have been 2 times (so far) that I've resorted to YouTube'ing a level to complete it (that's 2xs out of 100+?). So, in my opinion, Divide by Sheep is well balanced; the difficulty increases at an acceptable, steady rate which maximizes fun and minimizes frustration.

It *does* get a little repetitive at times, but Divide by Sheep is the sort of game that you can spend a couple of days away from yet come back to again (as opposed to taking a couple days off and forgetting the game exists) because the game really IS fun. Beyond the gameplay, the graphics are another positive point. The design/concepts are pleasantly ironic; there is a certain (and non-morbid) amount of satisfactory stress relief in killing sheep. Well. Not killing. Delivering them to the reaper. *cough* The cuteness of the graphics provides the perfect offset and absurdity level for what you will need to do in order to complete the levels of the game, i.e. kill sheep. 

One (albeit obscure) criticism is that the comic strip-like stills between levels, which sometimes appear to "explain" new features added to an upcoming level, are often rather opaque in the sense that they can be very difficult to make sense of. Thankfully, Divide by Sheep is highly forgiving - you can reset any given level after experimenting to learn about a new platform "The Hard (but still amusing) Way". Because of this the, at times confusing, explanatory stills do not pose a significant problem. Consider it a pet peeve.

One of the things I found very helpful (even if I didn't often avail myself of the feature because I am a stubborn completionist who will try and try again until I must YouTube because all of the stars) was the ability to wave a surrender flag if/when I was stuck. I appreciated that this was possible even if I did not take advantage of it.This feature would, in theory and practice, allow me to progress through the game (without needing to cheat YouTube walkthroughs) despite only being able to complete one or two out of three deliveries in a given level. The flag waving prevents stuck-ness and provides a lack of gated-ness that many modern puzzle games lack. This feature made Divide by Sheep more inviting and took the pressure off for a not-really-particularly-skilled-at-mental-math sort of person like me. (I'm better with theory. I swear.)

I 100% recommend this game to anyone who enjoys a well-made puzzle game and to anyone who is more pedestrian about puzzlers as well. Divide by Sheep IS solidly organized, thought out, and skillfully crafted, yet it remains pleasing for those who are slightly less particular about puzzlers.  There is no game snobbery here. If you insist upon elitism in gaming or consider "gamer" as a status symbol, Divide by Sheep isn't for you, probably. This game is pure egalitarian entertainment with logic, fried sheep, half sheep, sheep souls, wolves, TNT, sticky platforms, pigs, YOU NAME IT.

PS: As a professional educator, I'd be remiss if I didn't mention the educational value of the game - whether for young math learners, older folks warding off the brain fog that comes with aging (I probably qualify for this category), or an ice breaker for ESL students (linguistic demand is low). Divide by Sheep has much potential as a classroom/educational/mental flexibility tool while still being fun enough to not feel like a tool.

19655311.review:
A puzzle game requiring simple arithmetic. While at first glance it may seem like Yet Another Mobile Game, this is one that really shines on so many levels in so many areas.

Its difficulty level is just right, its learning curve is just right, its pacing curve is just right. It's cute, but not overly so, with dark humour, that's not overly dark. Small artistic touches abound wherever you look. The music adds to the mood and never becomes irritating. The tune for the Dark World even made me stop playing for awhile just to properly enjoy it.

For me, it was 10 hours of gameplay over 10 or so sittings. I'd feel like stopping after an hour or two, but I'd be left feeling satisfied rather than drained or bored. This is a good game to relax with now and then, and it doesn't overstay its welcome.

10/10 highly recommended, except for young kids (due to the visceral deaths). This review really doesn't do the game nearly enough justice, check out the other reviews or go watch a Let's Play.

18743834.review:
The only game where you can sacrifice sheep, cut them in half, put them back together and still win! Divide by Sheep has one of the easiest concepts for a puzzle game but yet still manages to make your brain explode whilst still making you want to keep playing more and more. Although, I can definitely recommend buying this as it is really fun, it still has a few things which could be improved which I will explain in my Pros and Cons.  

Pros:
♦ Great Gameplay that really makes you think without making you want to rage quit and never play again (There is the right balance here which makes it fun. It's one of those puzzles you just pick up and want to complete that no matter how frustrating it can be at times you never want to put it down until it's solved) 
♦ Decent number of Worlds and Levels (5 worlds, 30 levels a world, this is a good balanced number as it's not too few levels or too many. It doesn't leave you wanting more levels or make you feel like it's just dragging on and on becoming repetitive)
♦ Awesome Cartoon Styled Graphics (This adds a nice edge to the style of the game)
♦ Sound that just fits (Music and Sounds that can be listened to over and over again without sounding repetitive and annoying) 
♦ Decent Tutorials and Tutorial style (These are set of graphics/images before the level happens. They are well designed and detailed enough to understand what is going on which is awesome)
♦ Not Repetitive (Each World looks graphically different from the last and incorporates aspects from the previous but adds something new. Also each level is scaled on from the last making each level a unique puzzle in its own. This makes the game fun and not repetitive)
♦ Achievements are easy to get by just playing the game (Really easy to 100% if you can 100% all the puzzles)
♦ Star incentive to keep trying a level until you 100% it (This is a nifty way to draw people into keep them playing a level until they 100% it and get all 3 stars for the level)
♦ Awesome Graphical Story involving the Grim Reaper (For the minimal story in the game, it works)
♦ Decent looking Steam Trading Cards, Emoticons and Backgrounds (Really well designed)
♦ Controls just work (This is because the only thing you have to use is the mouse)
♦ Worth the Price of $5 (At a $1 a world or $1 per 30 levels, you will definitely get your moneys worth)

Cons:
♦ Don’t have to rescue/kill all the sheep, pigs or wolves (I found this part a weird concept as it felt like I was completing a Jigsaw Puzzle for example without using all the pieces).
♦ Ported from Mobile without 100% checking that everything is consistent for the PC version. (I say this as it says "Rate this App" in one of the tabs. This should say something like "Review this Game" and shows the Devs didn't bother checking it/changing it for pc)
♦ Can't skip some cut scenes (Such as Intro Scene)
♦ Some aspects seem randomly introduced such as Pigs (One second you’re just playing with Sheep & Wolves and the next you know you have Pigs. I just felt they could have introduced them better in my opinion)  
♦ Menu looks like Mobile still (This isn't a major issue as the game works fine, it would just be nice to have the menu looking more like a PC games to make it look more PC orientated then straight ported from Mobile)
♦ No Graphics or Resolution options (This is annoying if you want to play in different size resolutions or change from FullScreen to Windowed Mode as this is the type of game that would suit Windowed Mode) 

Side Note:
♦ Most people complain that this is a mobile port. In some aspects like the menus and options it is. However, if you can look past that fact, it is a really, really well made puzzle game that shouldn't fully be criticised on the fact that the Devs didn't fully change it for PC. With this said unlike some Mobile Ports, the Devs have made full use of the majority of Steam Features such as Achievements and Steam Trading Cards. Therefore, it's not just a straight Mobile Port in all aspects and the gameplay 100% works.

Overall, even though there are a couple of cons, they are only minor things which could improve the game slightly. 18185431.review:
[i]Key supplied by developer for review.[/i]
[h1]======================================[/h1]
[h1][b]Divide by Sheep[/b][/h1] (Read on for the full review!)
[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Divide by Sheep is a wonderfully crafted puzzle game, sporting a beautiful artstyle, well paced  difficulty increases with new feature introductions woven in, and a lovely dose of black humor.

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1][b]Pros[/b][/h1]
+Art: LOVELY modern-retro isometric style with great and vivid color choices.
+Gameplay: Clever use of "division" makes for a smooth and fun puzzle experience.
+Humor: The concept of the game alone is pure gold, even if the humor is black.
+Difficulty: New features and difficulty both come at a good pace, although there is sometimes inconsistency in said difficulty.
+Sound: The audio design is pretty good, and there are no problems that stand out.

[h1][b]Cons[/b][/h1]
-"Tutorial": The briefing for new features through the use of a single picture can make instructions a little murky at times.
-The menu is slightly awkward to navigate with a mouse.
-Nobody likes it when the "Rate this app!" page stays on a mobile port, but this isn't a huge deal.

[h1][b]Neutral[/b][/h1]
+/- It would be cool if there were even more options for how to divide the sheep.

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1][b]Introduction[/b][/h1]
Welcome to the wonderful world of Divide by Sheep, a fun puzzle game where it is your job to fling livestock from platform to platform to ensure the correct amount get to the end.

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]
Divide by Sheep is a puzzle game through and through. There's no run and gun, there's no portals, there's no incentive to click as fast as you can, there's no minigames or leveling up. All there is, is a collection of levels with simple mechanics used in very clever ways, and a goal. That's right, it's just you and your brain. You can take as much time as you need, and retry at any time, but be prepared to do it a lot if you intend to complete every level perfectly. 

Never before has it been more difficult to simply kill one sheep, or feed a few dogs. In your quest to (sometimes literally) extract these cute animals, you will have to systematically divide, subtract, and add to the groups of critters. You have various tools at your disposal for doing so, including incineration, lazers that split individuals in half, drowning, replacing (and still drowning,) jump pads that split your group up and send them in specific directions, platforms that swap with each other, etc.

Sacrifice is the name of the game, here, and it's never been more cute or fun. Divide by Sheep starts off relatively easy, and with great pacing gradually introduces more features and difficulty, although sometimes a level or two might be easier or significantly harder than previous ones. All of the puzzles are completely solvable and require experimentaiton or calculation, but never abstraction; you will never have that moment where you have to look up a solution to a puzzle and then go "How was I supposed to know that's what I was supposed to do?" The design of the levels is brilliantly clever and you will find yourself feeling increasingly satisfied with figuring out how to beat them with a perfect score. Get ready, it's really addicting!

[h1][b]Graphics[/b][/h1]
The graphics in Divide by Sheep are pretty simple, but very effective. It has a classic isometric style with modern design, with an almost vector art aesthetic. The menu transitions and navigation are smooth and simple, and I love how the UI stays almost completely out of the way, however, I will fault it slightly for clearly being intended for touch devices, and for having a rate this app page. There is also no option to change resolution. There is, however, a button to make the gameplay more child-friendly, which is really cool, and considerate of the developers, because this would be a great mental workout for any kid who can understand the mechanics.

If you've looked at the screenshots or trailers, then you know most of what you need to know about the game's graphics.

[h1][b]Audio[/b][/h1]
So there's not a whole lot to say about the audio in Divide by Sheep, except that I like the music, and surprisingly at no point found myself getting tired of it or completely tuning it out. The sounds are pleasant enough, and there's good audible feedback for actions and navigation. There are also no problems with the quality of the sound itself. 

[h1][b]Conclusion[/b][/h1]
Divide by Sheep is an exceptional puzzle game that will keep you busy for quite a while. It is challenging and engaging but never unfair. The content to price ratio is very good, and I am entirely comfortable recommending the game at full price...in fact, they could have charged more and I would still recommend it at full price. Seriously, treat yourself.

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url][/i]

Note: Review copy received from the developer. They also gave me an iPad key, and that is where most of the time I've spent on the game is.

Divide by Sheep is a fantastic puzzle game which requires players to use simple math in sheep's clothing for puzzle solving. Math is a tool, just like in the real world, making it a wonderful educational game, a great way to practice the kind of problem solving that is at the core of mathiness.

Although the game is hilarious (cutting sheep into hemispherical halves with their bones showing), it might not be appropriate for all children. Their "parental control" setting only removes blood splatters and could easily be turned back on by kids. Use your judgement, parents.

If you're not a parent, just enjoy the hilarity.

My full preview, to which I had nothing much to add when the game came out, is on [url=http://indiegames.com/2015/05/preview_divide_by_sheep_has_th.html] IndieGames.com [/url].

This is one of the few games I would recommend to anyone.  A fantastic little puzzler with a simple premise and an execution polished to a mirror sheen.  It's got cute colors and a catchy tune while also undercutting that overbearing sweetness with some violence and a quirky, dark story (simply and unobtrusively told through the occasional quick slide show).

The puzzles escalate beautifully and, while never holding your hand, the game starts you off extremely simply and takes you through increasingly complicated scenarios until, by the end of the game, you have a complete understanding of everything and are able to utilize the game's weird toolset to your advantage.  The puzzles get quite clever and what may be an obstacle to work around in one level will be made into a vital asset in another, simply as an emergent property of the interaction of simple rulesets.

Simply a great puzzle game.

18023670.review:
First impression:a casual puzzle game requiring arithmetic in a non-obvious way, but  ultimately boring

I'm going to go against the flow of 96% positive reviews here and not recommend this, because after 30 levels I felt bored by it and wasn't motivated to continue. But then I'm no fan of match-3 games either.

The one nice thing it does is that it lets you literally divide sheep in half (you can set the amount of gore from the main menu). Other than that, it's a straight-up puzzler that I think of as a "labyrinth" game: figure out the correct sequence of actions to reach your goal. Some levels have multiple ways to achieve that, but there's no reward for choosing one over the  other. I should also mention that the difficulty ramps up nice and even over the first 30 levels (of 150), and that new mechanics are introduced with little more than a picture hint and an opportunity for the player to research what they do in the next level (that's good).

A small nigle [i](steam doesn't let me spell this word correctly)[/i] I hold against it is that the game seems to favor playing by trial and error: when I want to do it perfectly and figure out a master plan before starting to move the sheep around, the game slows me down by making me do each hop (and animation) separately instead of doing broad sweeps: I wish I could swipe a group of sheep over several hops at once, or maybe swipe a circle on a group of islands and have every group make a hop to the neighboring island. Instead it is hop-wait-hop-wait, and precisely because the game avoids such grander mechanics, it's casual. Oh, and if you didn't turn the music off after 10 minutes I admire your patience. [There's more information on the music in the comments.]

I don't regret paying 0.99 for this game (it is 80% off), but I had hoped for something more memorable which it ultimately isn't. Try this one out if you get it in a bundle.

17991507.review: Головоломка с мобильных устройств. В ней есть всё, что требуется для хорошей игры подобного жанра. Абрис сюжета; отличная рисовка; простая основа геймплея, усложняющаяся с каждым уровнем. Мы играем за Смерть, которому очень скучно. И он решает собрать к себе в Преисподню заверюшек. Цель каждого уровня проста - надо заполнить 3 плота животными, перекидывая их между островками, состоящими из ограниченного количества клеток. Такой своеобразный гибрид пятнашек и Threes. Для начала мы просто используем клетки островов в виде математических знаков - прибавляем или отнимаем самых простых овечек, и отправляем нужное количество на плоты. Но тут в игре появляются волки, которые овечек едят, за ними - свиньи, которые выгоняют овечек с острова и всегда перекидываются первыми, и напоследок мы получаем огромный тотем, сжигающий всех зверей на островке. Параллельно появляются и новые разновидности островов - динамитные, с огненными ловушками, с телепортами, и.т.д. Кроме того, вводится в игру и операция умножения - специальный лазерный забор, разрезающий овечек напополам. К счастью, на плоту их сшивают обратно. Да, игра довольно жестока. И если поначалу мы зверюшек типа спасаем, то под конец, спойлер-спойлер, убиваем на потеху Смерти и скармливаем гигантскому спруту. Впрочем, всё это забавно нарисовано и не вызывает какого-то отторжения. Особенно хочется отметить интерфейс - кнопки паузы, отмены и настроек красивы и удобны. Единственный минус - избыток уровней. Да, игровой процесс увлекает всё повышающейся сложностью, но есть проходные задания. Уверен, вплоне можно было обойтись и 20 уровнями на каждый из 5 миров. Здесь же их по 30. В общем, рекомендую поклонникам жанра. В наличии достижения (на момент написания обзора, финальное достижение не работает, разработчик обещал исправить) и карточки. Перевода нет, но он и не нужен.

Defined by: Looks can be deceiving; don't judge a book by its cover.  At first it looked like a try-too-hard-to-be-cute mobile puzzler turned quick steam port cash grab, and it is indeed a port, but oh was I wrong.  From the opening cinematic you know things are slightly off. It reminded me of Happy Tree Friends, turning the cute visuals into a sometimes gruesome scene.  Usually I'm put off by things like this, but this game nails it.  The soundtrack is not something you'd probably throw on while not playing the game, but it is very entertaining. 

Down to the gameplay itself:  This is actually one of few puzzle games that I've been infuriatingly stumped by, making the success that much more satisfying.  As the name suggests, the puzzles revolve directly around math and sheep.  Also wolves, lazers, trampolines, and lots of death.  Use this to teach your kids about math...or prove to yourself you're bad at math.

17724946.review:
[h1]In-depth [b]3 minute Review[/b][/h1]Below the short informative review video, you'll also find a written review, should you prefer reading to listening.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tAGrlSLJFhw
[h1]Written Review[/h1]Divide by Sheep is a simple iOS port, which becomes obvious in the controls as well as in the lack of options. Often times, I would ignore blatant low-effort ports published on Steam for just another cash cow to milk. However, Divide by Sheep did surprise me in terms of its intelligent puzzle design. It first starts out simple enough with you trying to rescue specific amount of sheep in a certain order. This can be accomplished by utilising the size of islands, splitting certain herds with jump pads and so on. Soon, Divide by Sheep becomes a mashup of devouring sheep, sacrificing wolves or sheep for their souls, all while trying to give whatever the upper left corner of the screen at the current time point demands. I was really pleasantly surprised by how well the game gradually introduces more and more mechanics, melds them into more demanding puzzles and keeps you engaged and challenged throughout your playtime. At the same time, Divide by Sheep never pressures you, as the cute art style and relaxing soundtrack trot along with your gears doing the calculations. Should you be amongst the vast amount of people who never enjoyed maths in school though, you might not particularly desire to add, divide and plan ahead in Divide by Sheep. I personally enjoyed my time a whole bunch, except for the missing undo a move button, which led to me redoing a bunch of levels, as I out of idiocy did the wrong move a tad too early or too late. So yes, an undo button would have been great.
[h1][u]VERDICT[/u][/h1]All in all, Divide by Sheep will probably not lead to you falling asleep while counting. It’s a cute, polished puzzle game which provides a bunch of hours of gameplay for just a few bucks and can therefore be recommended easily to everyone enjoying a bit of numerical puzzling from time to time.

17295353.review:
If you would've told me a day ago that I was going to play a game all about math, division, and adorable little animals being cut in half, I would've called you crazy. Even more so for saying I was actually going to ENJOY it, of all things. That was yesterday. Today we have Divide by Sheep, a hilarious little puzzle game that is full of charm and some very challenging puzzles.

Now I feel before we move any further, we should really note something. This title is extremely App friendly in design. If you are somebody who gets easily bugged by that type of thing, you are going to grind your teeth as you gain 3 stars and see a complete lack of options menu. With that aside, I love Divide by Sheep. The game is disguised beautifully, but its all about math and putting numbers in the proper order to get the outcome you want. Using sheep, pigs, wolves, lasers and more, you will send the adorable little animals on their voyage to the hands of Death.

That's right, Death is lonely and wants a friend, but I mean Death is adorable, who wouldn't want to be his friend?

Small plot aside, the aesthetics and charm of Divide by Sheep is what got me hooked. This is incredibly important aspect to the game, otherwise it's just a math puzzle game. The dark humor is what kept me smiling, even when I got frustrated. So much so as a matter of fact, that if you are not a fan of math, you may not enjoy this title as much. You must bounce sheep or an assortment of animals to a raft that requires a specific number. Sometimes it's easy and sometimes it can be incredibly complicated. The difficulty scales rapidly and there have been more than a few times that Divide by Sheep has made me scratch my head and made my eyes go cross. More elements are introduced to complicate matters, such as limited number platforms, wolves that eat sheep, laser grids that divide sheep hilariously in half, and bouncing platforms that send your helpless animals flying.

That isn't to say that Divide by Sheep is too hard to beat or play though. If you can match just one of the numbers you are allowed to progress to the next level. Getting stuck is never an issue, and the challenge is one you set on yourself. Go for three stars or just say screw it and come back to it later, just like a real math test. Divide by Sheep has a large assortment of levels all with the 3 star challenge. The aesthetic of the levels does change from grassy halls to frozen tundras but for the most part, level design is always the same. Some floating platforms, which is your puzzle, and a raft to put X number of animals on.

On occasion after beating a number of levels, you are rewarded with an adorable piece of art, that usually explains a new up coming element in some manner.

It really is hard to find a fault with Divide by Sheep, because it's a very simplistic game. That in itself may be an issue though, because sometimes lets face it, math sucks. Mind you, this is why I'm a writer instead of a Architect or something that actually pays. But I digress. The point is, if Divide by Sheep had a fault it would be that it's a one trick pony. It doesn't exactly claim to be anything else than what it is, so this isn't a fault to the game. You should be more than aware what you're getting into if you buy this game. Aside from that and the App like nature of Divide by Sheep, it's bug free and is very fun to play. The replay value comes from trying to get 3 stars on every level, which unless you're very clever, is going to be long and challenging.

The options menu for the most part is non-existent, however there are parental controls if you wanted to leave the messy parts of the game out, like sheep being cut in half and leaving bloody messes. This feature while not incredibly important, is rather nice to be included and makes this game also a great learning tool. The music and soundtrack of Divide by Sheep are absolutely adorable and jaunty, matching the games almost carefree tone. It never really got grating on my ears or did any painful repeats. The music changes from area to area of the game thankfully so there is always something new to listen to around the corner.

I have played plenty of puzzle games but none that actually made math fun for me. I am not huge fan of Sudoku or other games of its nature. That in itself is an incredible compliment to the games level design. After being stuck on a level for a while and finally beating it, you get the "aha!" feeling that is quite addictive. Divide by Sheep may not be incredibly innovative but I haven't seen many games like it.

There are some areas that Divide by Sheep could've added a little bit more to make the game user friendly. There is no hint button or any hand holding whatsoever, so if you bang your head against the wall, you are heading to Youtube or a forum for help. While there is a quick start over button, a undo last move button would've been very nice for some of the more complicated puzzles that involved many steps. While these puzzles are rare they do happen, and having to start completely over again left me a little wanting. 

Divide by Sheep is available on Steam and mobile markets, the price is representative of that fact at $4.99. This makes it an absolutely steal if you love puzzle games, plus hey, Steam achievements are always fun. You can always nab this game for on the go at $2.99 on the iTunes store. This game makes a great traveling companion. So if you are in the market for an incredibly adorable puzzle game that is going to give you plenty of bang for your buck and more than likely make you scratch your head, I can't think of a better game than Divide by Sheep.

Скажу честно: мне повезло получить эту игру задаром. Но если бы заранее знал, что меня будет ждать, купил бы не раздумывая.

"Добрейшая" и милая игра о том, как одинокая смерть решила завести друзей самым логичным методом: затопив всех и встретив на том свете. И нам придётся спасать ранее друживших, а теперь выживающих на островах бедных зверушек, овечек, волчат и поросят, буквально закидывая их на спасательные шлюпки, по три разных шлюпки со своими требованиями к спасаемым зверькам на каждом уровне. Игра довольно быстро становится аки Happy Tree Friends, примерно в тот момент, когда игрок осознает, что зверушки не ладят друг с другом и не будут давать друг другу ни одного свободного места, что разные звери могут пакостить другим, и что для решения задачек одних придётся скидывать в воду, других резать напополам лазерами ("Тебе сказали что нужны две овечки, а теперь их "четыре"? Склеим изолентой, будут как новенькие!"), третьих оставлять на ящиках с динамитом, чтобы импровизированный остров не подорвался, а четвёртых сжигать на алтарях, чтобы у Смерти появилось побольше новых друзей...

Из плюсов:
* Умилительная анимация и стилистика 
* Черный юмор во все поля (одно удовольствие смотреть на сытых волчат или на летящее в воду с "#@%$"! зверьё)
* Простая механика... (всё, что то вас требуется - отправлять зверей в полёт до следующего острова и смотреть на результат)
* ...И при этом - довольно сложные паззлы с большим количеством решений (если вы пытаетесь проходить уровни идеально, конечно же), требующие расчётов и подсчётов (ага, игра незаметно заставляет нас вспоминать математику) перед любыми действиями.
* Разнобразные задания и новые элементы геймплея по ходу игры (поначалу, в "белой и пушистой" части игры мы будем заниматься лишь спасением овец, но после перейдём и на резку овец пополам, и на кормление и спасение волков, и на нарочитое умервщление зверей для одинокой Смерти, и на пуляние свиней, а иногда всё и сразу на одном уровне)
* Всё это жуть как цепляет и надолго
* Всё минималистично и наглядно, включая небольшие комиксы-обучения новым элементам игры
* Приятный саундтрек и звуки
* Багов и глюков не было замечено во время игры
* Малая цена даже без скидки, около сотни рублей

Из... честно, язык не поворачивается называть их минусами, скорее придирками, потому что зная другие игры этого издателя я почему-то уверен, что всё это могут быстро исправить:
* Невооружённым глазом заметно, что игра затачивалась под тач управление и телефоны, что приводит к паре других проблем: 
* Всё управление - через мышку. Клавиатура не используется совсем, даже в меню и несмотря на нарисованные стрелки для выбора уровней и не только, что непривычно
* Настроек почти что и нет, лишь по звуку и по вкл\откл родительского режима (надо было такую функцию тоже отнести к плюсам, к слову, учитывая неприязнь многих к крови и мясу)
* Из-за своей полной минималистичности не только в дизайне, но и в меню, в настройках и всём-всём игра на первый взгляд выглядит довольно... дёшево, если честно. Но с другой стороны за неё и просят не так уж и много
* Рейтинг вида "1-3 звездочки за уровень". Лично меня это не тревожит, но знаю многих, кто цепляются к такой мелочи
* На данный момент лишь 120 уровней (4 мира, каждый из 30 паззлов, каждый со своей центральной тематикой (Вначале спасаем овец, потом волков, после Смерть пожалует, а после свиньи ленивые захотят спасения)), но новые уровни "Coming Soon"

Если вам нравятся цепляющие паззлы с более чем одним решением поставленной задачи... или же вам просто доставляет сам факт того, что премилое зверьё в этой игре можно топить\резать\скармливать волкам\пихать в ловушки\сжигать\пулять\взрывать\стравливать друг с другом в потасовке\скармливать кавайному Кракену и после этого спокойно смотреть на то, как уплывают лодки со "спасёнными" 2 с половиной овечками - это для вас. Даже не сомневайтесь

16846968.review:
Divide by Sheep is a math puzzle wrapped into cute graphics with some dark humor. In this game you need to jump correct numbers of sheep / wolves onto a raft. To do this you set the animals flying back and forth between islands of varous capacity. If you try to put more sheep onto an island than it can fit, they'll fall into water and drown (which is often required - sometimes you'll need to drown sheep instead of saving them). You'll get to drown sheep, slice them in half and then duct tape them back together, feed them to the wolves and much more. 

As you play the game more and more modifiers are added and it gets much more challenging. Slice a sheep in half and now it occupies two slots on an island instead of one, feed wolves with some excess sheep so they become heavy and fed and don't jump over to other islands. With several worlds to complete, it offers a different set of rules and goals in each one adding variety to the gameplay. Much recommended.

16846083.review:
*Reviewed With A Press Key*

Divide by sheep is a very fun puzzle game where you have to get the correct amount of sheep onto a raft, which sounds simple enough but you will have to sacrifice Sheep in order to save the correct amount. There are a tonne of different mechanics it seems as I'm only 20 levels in and already seen 6 different mechanics that add a lot of thought into the game such as little rat things that swallow your sheep. The game is laid out very mobile like but controls very well.

*Gameplay*

You jump your sheep across islands that can only fit a certain amount of Sheep, if your sheep can't fit then they fall off to their death which may be nessesary. Like I said there are a tonne of mechanics that change the way you think and play.

*Conclusion*
This game is very fun and easy to learn and I highly recommend picking up the game. I give it a 9/10 for being, fun, addictive and just awesome.
